abstract: Romney vs. Santorum proves to be Ali/Frazier for the media, China reinforces limits on Western cultural products and Google punishes itself.
snippet: Romney vs. Santorum proves to be Ali/Frazier for the media, China reinforces limits on Western cultural products and Google punishes itself.
lead_paragraph: Just when you thought the intense news analysis of the presidential choices of 120,000 Iowa Republicans couldn’t get any more granular, Tuesday night’s caucuses produced a result that, as news anchors are fond of saying, showed that “each vote counts.” It was thrilling stuff for the anchors, who enjoyed the tension, as Brian Stelter writes. “We have no idea when we’ll be able to call this,” Rachel Maddow said at 10 p.m. “It’s great.” The cable networks continued on toward 3 a.m. Eastern, after Mitt Romney was declared the winner by eight votes – though, helpfully, he was ahead by a 10th of a decimal point, 24.6 percent vs. 24.5 percent for Rick Santorum.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Iowa Under the Microscope and China vs. the West
